dialogues.text: (to the Elemental) What now, Big Boy? You get a ladder? The Elemental jumps up and down, trying to reach him, barking in frustration. Hellboy's RADIO crackles:

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (on the radio) HB? This is Blue. The Princess is fine.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: So, lead him to the bridge. Hellboy looks over the buildings and sees the Brooklyn Bridge in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: That's nine blocks from here, Fishbowl!

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: You'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: What's at the bridge? Abe - ? Liz? Hello??? No answer. Muttering, Hellboy climbs higher, up a buzzing neon sign reading "Hotel". The Elemental smashes the letters "tel"... so Hellboy cli the "0" to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz drives the garbage truck toward the Brooklyn Bridge. Johann is sitting next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy makes a running start and leaps off the building. sails over the alley, reaches for the approaching cornice and almost loses his grip! He hangs on for dear life. Behind him, the Elemental appears, climbing onto an adjac roof. As his feet smash through the skylights, the Elemen pulls down a WATER TOWER. A wall of water rolls toward Hellboy, like an ocean wave! Hellboy leaps to the next roof... and the water shoots ov the edge of the building, cascading onto the street below

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz parks the truck near the Brooklyn Bridge. Using binoculars, Abe peers out the back doors to see Hellboy bringing the Elemental closer.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Johann - they're almost here. Johann moves among massive construction machinery. He sto at a stack of heavy SPOOLS OF CABLE. Abe comes running, pointing at the cable.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Yes. I had the very same idea... He gets behind the levers and handles of a complex machin which holds a half mile of steel cable.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (gazing at the controls) .but how do you operate this??

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: If you'll permit me... Johann opens his fingers, and plunges both arms deep into the mechanism! Instantly, the diesel engine STARTS UP.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: (to Abe) Stand back, Abe. A hydraulic strut lifts the spool, then pitches it throug the air, spinning off 300 yards of cable. It splashes dow near the far shore of the East River.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Now, tie it onto the pontoons on the other side. (seeing Hellboy coming) Quickly, Abe!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WATER 94
dialogues.text: Abe races down a pier and dives smartly into the dark wat Then he surfaces, surging dolphin-like toward the Manhatt shore.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKLYN BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Hellboy makes it to the bridge... as, behind him, the Elemental wades into the river, pushing aside boats and barges.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RIVER
dialogues.text: Abe makes it to the other side, surfacing with the cable, towing it to a half-submerged pontoon.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on the radio) Macht schnell! Abe - make it fast! The cable is a yard short of the anchor point! Abe tugs o

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: I need more!

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: No more available! The Elemental's feet stomp through the river; he stumbles he encounters the submerged cable. 97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clinging to the cable, Abe is dragged down, down down... past rusting cars, oil drums... and a couple of rotting CORPSES, their feet in tubs of cement! Suddenly, Abe's head strikes a sunken truck, knocking him unconscious. Blood seeps from his wound. 98

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: As Hellboy climbs one of the bridge towers, he hears some calling out from above:

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) Haven't you managed to kill it yet? You, who were so eager for a fight? The Prince is standing on top of the tower. He points at Hellboy, then yells at the Elemental.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: (to the Elemental) Over here, dear friend... SNATCH! The Elemental plucks Hellboy off a parapet! Hellb wriggles in the massive wooden finger-like appendages.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 62
dialogues.text: The Prince walks to the edge of the tower, near a steel spire, his coat flapping in the night wind.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: This might be a good chance for you to come to your senses. Help us.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: I've been all through this! The answer's still no! Far below, Johann slips his right arm into the cable, bringing it to life, whipping it back and forth, like a steel snake! The cable forms a huge loop, splashing down near the Elemental and tightening around his ankles. The cable

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: (to Liz) Burn the roots!!! Burn them!!i He points at the roots trailing into the river. Liz concentrates and a bolt of fierce white-hot energy pours of her hands, burning the roots at the Elemental's feet. Johann gyrates; the cable responds, whipping up out of th river! With a bellow, the Elemental loses his balance; he tosses Hellboy high into the air. On the way down, Hellboy grabs a support stay and swings back and forth like a red monkey. He lands atop of the Elemental's back, right behind his head.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Nap time, Big guy- He raises his stone fist and hits him straight in the bac of the neck. The cable tenses- -The Elemental pitches forward- The Prince looks up to see the Elemental falling right at him; his mouth opens as if to scream... The Elemental goes down, impaling himself on a spire atop the bridge... exactly where the Prince had been standing. Putting an end, it seems, to both of them.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 63
dialogues.text: The Creature dies, but even as it does, its branches embr the steel structure and grow, Ultimately, blocks and bloc of the city are now covered in trees and grass and mossy leaves... A strangely beatific and precious change. Liz runs up, looking out at the river as Abe emerges, bleeding, but alive. Abe, Liz and Johann embrace firmly, laughing and happy to be together. Abe eyes the Princess standing nearby, smiling back at him... Hellboy meanwhile observes the group from a distance, jealous, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! BLAM! Deafening shots as Hellboy blasts the Samarit again and again at a target in the dark firing range. Hit button, brings the paper close for inspection. Result: a very ragged, loose pattern around the bull's ey Suddenly, from the next alley, RAPID GUNFIRE. Johann lean over, and to address Hellboy through a cloud of gunsmoke.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: You'll permit a small criticism? You take too much time to aim, to think. Nein. Just point- like afinger- as if you wish for something.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Oh, I wish for something. Johann brings his target close: a beautiful, tight cluste of shots, dead center.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Speed is of the essence. You must work on it. I'm willing to spend some - Johann reaches for his loader, accidentally knocks Helibo onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Hey, watch it! You're winding me up, I don't like it.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: On the contrary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy's in the shower, glaring across the room, where Johann stands at a mirror, polishing his glass head with terry cloth towel.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: You keep wiping that thing like she's gonna care.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: She- Who-??

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: You know who- She- (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not gonna care.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: (long beat) You think I'm after Liz, don't you? (Hellboy walks out) Well, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Why not? (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good enough for you? Hellboy wraps a towel around his waist and comes up behin Johann.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Well- From now on, you don't come near her. You don't talk to her-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: You forget. I'm part of the team now, such interactions are inev-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Well- you better start making them "evitable"-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: That's not a word-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Yes, it is-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: No, it isn't- Hellboy raises his stone fist.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Now it is-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Oh, I see- you want to punch me- That's how you win an argument.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: I try.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Well, you're big, I'll give you that much-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: "Give me???"- You don't give me sh-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: -and you're strong- but you're slow.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Slo-??

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Very- slow- I've seen your fighting style. Very slow- WHAM-! Hellboy cracks Johann over the head with his massi fist. To his surprise, the Johann's glass ball cranium shatters!

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Slow enough for ya-?? With a loud HISSS, Johann's odd suit sags to the floor!

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Ow- Johann... buddy. Sorry- I- I- got carried away... (leaning over the empty suit) Johann? You still hear me? An ectoplasmic TENDRIL reaches out from the suit and penetrates the closest locker.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: It was an accident, okay? I'll get you some help-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 66
dialogues.text: With a CLANG! -- the bank of lockers comes to life! Metal doors smack Hellboy's head repeatedly, like a pinball machine! his face imprinted in the metal.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: See? Speed is the key. The vaporous form of Johann's body emerges from the locke and wanders away. The locker room doors open and close as goes by. Hellboy tries to stand, wobbles and sits.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Chicken shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe floats in his tank, smiling at the Princess, who's at one of the book stands, reading to him.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: "I sometimes have a queer feeling - especially when you are near me, as now: it is as if I had a string somewhere under my left ribs, tightly and inextricably knotted to a similar string situated in the corresponding quarter of your little frame."

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: I love this part. Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: "I am afraid that cord of communion will be snapt; and then I've a nervous notion I should take to bleeding inwardly." She closes the book, looking troubled.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Charlotte Bronte died shortly before I was born. It would have been a great privilege to have known her...

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: This "Jane Eyre"... I understand it's only a story, but such a tie that binds, it exists between me and my brother. I assure you: my brother, he's not dead-

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: How can you know? We all saw-

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: We are twins. Even now, I can sense his presence. This has been our way since we were young children, in Renvyle-

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Renvyle, Ireland- The ancient isles-

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magical place in the West. A different time. Long gone. Now, he's near and he's looking for me. I can feel and even understand his. hatred for mankind.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Men... usually mean well, I believe that. But they need our help and patience.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: You were very brave, vouching for me. How do you know I'm not the enemy, bringing me here?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: It's as you were saying, I suppose. From intuition, feeling. I've never met anyone like you... but that's my instinct. They gaze fondly at each other through the glass, as bubb swirl out of Abe's gills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is patching Hellboy's injured head. In the background the TV's are playing up: CITY LIGHTS, WHITE HEAT and some programming.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: He caught me off-guard- but I'll get him next time. He's examining a few letters, contract forms, etc.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: There shouldn't be a "next time" we're all part of the same team.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: We are- he's not- The guy's an egomaniac. You can see right through him. (PAUSE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a joke, Liz. Liz remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (raises a letter) Look!! They wanna do a cartoon series, based on me? And this: (he holds up a box of cereal) Product endorsement - breakfast of demons. And a videogame!!! As CITY LIGHTS ends, Liz lifts the remote to turn the vol up.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Gosh, that was so sweet, so sad- It always gets me- Red- There's something I need to-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (taking the remote) No, wait. (switching to Leno) Look that's us- Jay is showing some footage from the giant incident.

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: So- this "Hellboy" what is he?? Is he really on our side?? I mean, he's red, has a tail and shaves his horns- horns, Ladies and Gentleman. Horns are never a good sign.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (CHUCKLES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha- He's funny.

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: Maybe we should have him come over and talk to us a little, uh? Whaddayathink?? The crowd roars.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: That's a great idea, don't you think??

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: No, I don't-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Did you know that during the commercial breaks the orchestra keeps playing so the guest can't talk to Jay... keeps the conversation fresh.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: How do you know these things?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: I read it in TV Guide.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You're really liking this, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: We should do this-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It's a bad idea. All of it- Do you really need everybody to like you?? What's in it for you?? Are we not enough??? She leaves. Hellboy glances at Leno on TV: a dog outfitte in a ballerina costume is jumping around with a red ball balanced on its nose. Hellboy chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: That's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is looking out into Trenton NJ's light landscape. Joh approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Are you alright-? Liz nods weakly.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: May I be of assistance??

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: He's a big brute, isn't he?? Liz chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: But he has a good heart. I know it. He means well.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I think I may have made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: In what way, Mein Frau??

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Just a mistake- nothing important. (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sometimes being with him is not easy-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: It never is. I know. Lis looks at him with renewed interest.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: I was married once. A long, long time ago... And only after I lost her- I realized that my life would never be quite the same- And my loss lead me to become what I am today... Johann's human face materializes inside his glass helmet.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: I- I tried constantly to make contact with her-

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Johann's mouth opens and out of it emerges a large tendri of ectoplasm. His neck engorges and the substance continu to flow freely out of his mouth and fingertips--

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: It was only there- in the Ethereal plane that I ever gazed upon her again... CAMERA close in on several ceremonial candles burning in room. Their flame illuminating the eerie scene.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 71
dialogues.text: Out of the mouths of the other guests, emerge other, equa large ectoplasmic shapes. They cross to-

dialogues.speaker: THE ETHEREAL PLANE 105
dialogues.text: Once there- they reform into humanoid shapes, vaguely reminiscent of their mortal bodies. JOHANN floats freely, approaching another humanoid form i the void: That of a woman, his wife.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: But it was there, while he was partially on the ethereal plane, that disaster

dialogues.speaker: STRUCK-
dialogues.text: He is about to embrace his wife's form when a horrible rumble occurs and the void bursts in flames, destroying a distorting everything around him- His wife's shape screams and evaporates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BPRD agents break in on the scene. Smoke and flames billo in the room, wax puddles stand where the CEREMONIAL CANDL were and seated around the seance table, charred corpses hold hands in eternal contact. As the Agents move around pale, vaporous shape emerges from the soot-stained darkne It's Johann.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: All the seance attendees were incinerated. The only survivor -and only to some extent- was me- Why? I'll never

dialogues.speaker: KNOW--
dialogues.text: The form moves towards its body and attempts to climb bac and reanimate it, but the CHARRED CORPSE is barely amble amble a few steps forward before collapsing into ash and bone... The shape of Ectoplasm stands there, alone and lo Then, Professor TREVOR BROOM wanders into the scene and approaches the form-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: It was then that Professor Broom and the B.P.R.D. devised a containment suit for me. A new body-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 72
dialogues.text: CAMERA pulls back to reveal-

dialogues.speaker: BALCONY BPRD
dialogues.text: Johann, back in the balcony, talking to Liz.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: I owe Professor Broom everything that I've become. He brought me back to life- He grows silent for a brief moment.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: But I've never been able to see her again. My reach became limited- My loss, infinite... Liz puts her hand on his shoulder. Johann takes it...

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Loss- the very threat of it makes us vulnerable... makes us care- You can see that, don't you?? Without her I became but an empty shell... Liz leans her head on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Don't give up on him. Not yet. Liz chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: No. Not yet. CAMERA discovers HELLBOY, watching them from behind a gla door, a six-pack in his hand. He steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heliboy walks down a deserted corridor carrying his six pack. He stops, puzzled. Strains of Barry Manilow are emanating from the library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy enters the library and goes over to the tank. Abe there, listening to Vivaldi.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Ah, hello Red. You're up late.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Liz and I- we had a fight-

dialogues.speaker: OH-
dialogues.text: Hellboy eyes the CD player.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Did I hear Barry Manilow just now?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (smiles hypocritical) Barry M- oh, Gosh- no- no- (fast, stammering) It was er- urm- Vivaldi. Il cimento dell'armonia I believe I particularly admire the passage... Hellboy hits the eject button on Abe's CD player. The mus stops and he pulls out a different CD from the changer.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: What's happening to you??

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Ooh- Ooh- (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my life I thought I was alone, a made- up name and a random pasted on a cylinder. But then I saw her- She's like me. A creature from another world... Alone... Brother Red- I think I'm in love.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: You say that like it's a good thing. (looks at the CD) What track?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (ASHAMED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Track eight-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (READS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God- you're disgusting-

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: I know-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: "Can't smile without you"

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: I'd cry, but I don't have the glands for it.. (DESPERATE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I going to do, Red???? Hellboy sighs and pops a beer, presses play and sighs heavily, looks around-

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: I miss him- Father- don't you??

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyday.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: He would tell what to do- He would tell what's right- what's wrong-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: He did that for all of us... The opening strings of "Can't Smile Without You."

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (sips beer) You know? I- I never much appreciated Manilow's artistry that much- until now- Now it seems to be a grand poet and speaks directly to my innermost feelings.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Jeez- You need to get out more- The two of them sit there, growing quiet, listening to th syrupy music. Then, slowly, the two of them start singing low at first and then at the top of their voices, moved a teary-eyed. 110

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess hears the distant music and smiles, but then feels a chill down her spine. She shudders and moves to t panoramic window and gazes outside, to the woods and the distant city lights below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music can be heard at a distance. A dark figure stands on a hill, amid the trees, listening and watching... CAMERA MOVES IN: the Prince gazes at the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning strides down the corridor, followed by the BPRD team. All of them dressed in BLACK LEATHER OUTFITS.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: This is a whole new ballgame and I want you to take my lead.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: I find these leather outfits very

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Maybe so, maybe so- but they look- hip. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it comes to dealing with reporters or the public, I set the tone. You all know the old saying: the perception is the reality.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Correctamundo, chief. For one thing, we can ditch the garbage truck, right?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Wait, Red, the lab's in it-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Screw the lab. I want new wheels.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: (SMIRKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got 'em- The round a corner and enter -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three gleaming Hummers await them.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: A gift from General Motors. One for each of you. Each Hummer has custom paint: Hellboy's with scenes of Dante's inferno, Liz's with flames and Abe's with an underwater vista.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: This is more like it!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I'm not driving that- Abe has opened the hood on his Hummer.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: This is a most unfortunate vehicle. The sheer waste of precious fossil fuels...

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: An American custom, it's called product placement! What's the harm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mob of SCREAMING FANS outside the TV studio. The frenzy intensifies when they see the Hummers pulling up. As the BPRD team exits the cars, autograph seekers break through the POLICE LINE and swarm around the heroes.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Every agent on the field is on the case. They will solve it-- Hellboy signs a color photo of himself with a flourish.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: There you go, pal. "To Jason, best wishes, Hellboy."

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: (squints at the signature) How am I supposed to read that?

dialogues.speaker: BELLBOY
dialogues.text: You don't like it?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 77
dialogues.text: Irritated, he scowls at the fan. Manning takes him by the elbow and leads him away.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (to the fan) That turns up on e-Bay, I'm gonna find you, "Jason"... 115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of makeup chairs. Manning sits in the first one, looking at himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Can you do anything about this... uh... (lowers his voice) -double chin?

dialogues.speaker: MAKEUP GIRL
dialogues.text: No, you're not being made up.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: MAKEUP GIRL
dialogues.text: They said, you're too normal. You don't need anything.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: But- Believe me- I'm not normal at all... 2 CAMERA MOVES to the next makeup chair, where Makeup Girl holds a camelhair brush and stares dubiously at Abe.

dialogues.speaker: MAKEUP GIRL 2
dialogues.text: So, what color is that- green?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Carribbean Blue, actually. CAMERA MOVES to the next makeup chair, where the very sex Makeup Girl 3 gingerly touches Hellboy's chest.

dialogues.speaker: MAKEUP GIRL 3
dialogues.text: Are these really scars?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Well, yeah. Each one tells a story- His grin fades as he sees Johann talking to Liz. He abrup gets up and goes to them.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: That about you, glass-man? A few squirts of Windex?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: I'm not going on. And if I may- a word of

dialogues.speaker: ADVICE-
dialogues.text: (long beat, then sotto voce) -it's not a good idea to hint that you two have... a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Thanks a bunch. I'll decide that.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: You don't know how people may react.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: It's a love story. They'll lap it up.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: I know you don't like me, but trust me on this one. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew your father- he was a friend- Hellboy blinks, taking the information in.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Do as you may- But know this- he wouldn't have approved of your behaviour. A P.A. opens the door. P.A. You're on-!

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: I'll be watching from the truck lab, where I belong- Go, enjoy your fifteen minutes... He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: SIGN
dialogues.text: A busy Moscow Subway station, not very crowded at this ti of night. Sleepy patrons await the arrival of the subway.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 79
dialogues.text: One of them, a puppet vendor, showcases his product. He manipulates a wooden marionette: A KNIGHT in SHINING ARMO In the distance- lights, bright lights and the train ROAR The Puppeteer readies his merchandise bag and quickly mov to the edge of the platform alongside other passengers. T lights grow in intensity and the ROAR becomes deafening. something's wrong, really, wrong-

dialogues.speaker: PUPPETEER
dialogues.text: Hooy na ny! The lights are in reality, the eyes of a giant dragon and roars into the platfrom, demolishing pillars, crushing people and eating the puppeteer in a matter of second. Pandemonium ensues. 117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warning light goes off on the Truck's GLOBAL POSITIONIN

dialogues.speaker: MAP
dialogues.text: But Johann and the other agents are too absorbed watching the Leno show on the bank of monitors.

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, yesterday we saw some extraordinary things on TV. And tonight you're in for more.

dialogues.speaker: TV SHOW
dialogues.text: Jay Leno grins and pulls his microphone close.

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: Please extend a warm, warm welcome to Hellboy, Liz Sherman, Abe Sapien, and Special Agent Tom Manning. Uproarious applause as the BPRD team comes out and make their way to the couch. 119

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone in the BPRD conference room, the Princess is watchi the show. The massive Yrdrig is curled up at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: LEND
dialogues.text: Wow, So - He's pointing at Manning.

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: .what planet are you from?

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Washington, D.C., Jay. It's hot and inhospitable to human life.

dialogues.speaker: LEND
dialogues.text: Funny. (to Liz) Why are you just "Liz" and not Fire Girl?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I was born in Milwaukee, so it was just plain old Liz ever since first grade.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Hey, we do call her Sparky now and then. A chuckle from the crowd. Hellboy smiles in satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: LEND
dialogues.text: (to Abe) And you, Abe. Is it uncomfortable at night with that toilet seat around your neck? The Princess smiles as the camera singles out Abe for a closeup.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Actually, Mr. Leno, my lungs are more like gills. I need to convert the air's nitrogen into oxygen, otherwise I'd suffocate in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: LEND
dialogues.text: (NODDING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha. We call that stand-up comedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johann is groaning. This is turning unpleasant. Behind hi the map's lights are lightning up non-stop.

dialogues.speaker: LENO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, Hellboy: what's your favorite food? Devil's food cake? Do you have a last name? More laughter at HB. Liz mortified. She touches HB's hand restrain him. Cameras zoom in on this.

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: Whoa. What's that- Are you two an item?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Uh... I-

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: (to Liz) Care to comment on that? Sounds like you're contemplating marriage!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: (after a big pause) You know, Jay, we are- together. We are. Rumble of consternation from the audience.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Manning, I think your polls just tanked. He turns to see the map- lit like a christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Mein Gott- 121

dialogues.speaker: TV SHOW
dialogues.text: Leno smiles at the audience, which is buzzing.

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: Folks, this is modern America. A guy in Rhode Island married his motorcycle! What's a little inter-species romance in this day and age?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Scattered BOOING from the back row. Jay turns back to

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: Okay, here's what we've really been wondering: Is he just like every guy? In every respect? I mean, he looks like a guy... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 82
dialogues.text: LENO(continued) and if so, are you using any protection? A layer of asbestos might be in order, don't you think? Liz tenses up in silence. Holds tight to HB's hand. Hellboy is ready to explode.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, Jay- Before she can finish, the production assistant runs out hands a NOTE to Leno, who scans it and grows serious:

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: We we're getting pre-empted, ladies and gentlemen. Please, bare with us. We'll be right back- CAMERA PUSHES IN on one of the MONITORS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: News footage of the Ginza features YOKAI GHOSTS on a rampage, destroying the stores and attacking salarymen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER 1
dialogues.text: This is a news alert. Tokyo is under assault - repeat - this city has been attacked. Monstrous beings, defying description, have waded into the Ginza- The jumpy, handheld images are full of digital interferen The spectral BEASTS drag down power lines and hurl cars.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER I
dialogues.text: - where police are helpless and hospitals overwhelmed. One moment, please. Moscow... come in, Moscow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red Square, Moscow now seen in similar, shaky video. Hundreds of citizens are running from a towering, DRAGON.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
dialogues.text: This is CNN in Moscow, where a Dragon has laid claim to Red Square. Yes- a DRAGON.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 83
dialogues.text: The DRAGON heads towards the TV REPORTER and screeching, raises its PAW.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER 2
dialogues.text: Oh, my God... CAMERA goes down, then the picture winks out. Black screen. The HISS of static... PAN off the monitor to Jay Leno, who sits in stunned silence, like everyone else. Finally, he looks over at Hellboy.

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: Friends of yours?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (GROWL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -!

dialogues.speaker: LENO
dialogues.text: Then, may I ask what you're doing here? Shouldn't you be out protecting humanity instead of hooking up with our women? At last, Hellboy explodes. Bellowing, he rips up the desk and throws it through the backdrop!

dialogues.speaker: TNT. BPRD
dialogues.text: The Princess snaps off the TV, looking worried. Alone with her thoughts, she examines the curved gold pie hanging from a chain around her neck. She closes her eyes and shudders - trouble is near. The Yrdgrig wakes up and whimpers. 125

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video cameras record the journey of the Princess as she makes her way through the nearly-deserted corridors.

dialogues.speaker: TNT. LIBRARY
dialogues.text: A VIDEO surveillance camera in the BPRD library records t Princess as she crosses to Abe's tank.

dialogues.speaker: BELLBOY 2 84
dialogues.text: She hides the gold segment within the pages of "Jane Eyre At that moment, the Yrdrig GROWLS -

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: Shhh, it's all right - BOOM-! A jolt shakes the room. A-moment later, a wall collapses as warty, heavily muscled ARMS and FINGERS tear the masonry! in seconds, a squad of TROLLS pulls itself into view! WIN leers at the Princess. From her waistband, she produces a long, thin DAGGER and wields it timidly. Somewhere in the building, ALARMS start clanging. The Yrdrig shakes himself into action and springs. With a SNARL, it attaches its several jaws onto the neare trolls. As the fighting creatures crash into the spiral staircase, the Princess hears a familiar voice:

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Hold. The Prince steps into the room, carrying a long spear. The trolls are on top of the Yrdrig, ready to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Come-! The trolls release the Yrdrig and bound over to the Princ The last troll, however, grabs the Yrdrig by the neck and brutally twists -! The animal's three mouths yelp and cough, fighting for ai - the It thrashes pathetically until, suddenly, it's over beast is dead.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Where is your sense of shame? You mingle with... the liars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARMS are ringing as the Hummers pull into the undergrou parking garage. Manning and Hellboy jump out of their vehicle and see -

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 85
dialogues.text: - a couple of dead AGENTS sprawled on the loading dock.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: What in God's name- ? Hellboy, Abe, Liz and Johann race past him, disappearing into the building. The alarm bells are deafening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy leads the way down the corridors, which are alive with scrambling personnel. Several BPRD employees are lyi on the floor, wounded and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The top-level human agents are clustered in the lobby, th guns drawn, all of them aiming at the Prince and his drooling bodyguards. Standoff. As Hellboy and the team arrive, Abe sees the Princess, he arms tied. Her brother holds her by the hair.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Princess! Without thinking, he darts forward. Instantly, one of the trolls swipes at him, its claws just missing his chest-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Abe! No, get back!! Abe regains his balance and tries again, his eyes glued t the desperate features of the beautiful young woman. Hell manages to restrain him.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: Mr. Sapien, don't! He'll kill you!

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: I'll kill you all, if that's what you want.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: No. Why don't you just start with me? Hellboy strolls up to the Prince.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: You challenge-me?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: You bet your ass I do-

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Your weapon of choice?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (holds up his massive hand) Five-fingered Mary. In the background, Manning arrives, wide-eyed. Just in ti to see the Prince hand off his captive to one of the trol He drops back, flips his spear to horizontal and waits fo Hellboy's attack. 130

dialogues.speaker: FIGHT
dialogues.text: Hellboy feints left, goes right and whips around, swingin his tail at the Prince. The Prince leaps and jabs with th spear, poking a hole in Hellboy's coat. The surrounding crowd backs away as the combatants circle each other. The Prince is nimble. The Prince is quick. He thrusts the spear again and again, driving Hellboy into a display case full of antique weapons. The glass breaks and a number of swords and axes fall to floor.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) Arm yourself! Use the flail!.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Not my style. Watch and learn, fish bowl. He punches the Prince, hard. The blow knocks the Prince t his knees; as he rises, Hellboy connects with a brutal combination. In the arms of the troll, the Princess' head rockets back and forth, as if struck. A moan of pain escapes from her lips.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (seeing this) H.B., no! Stop - you mustn't harm him! As the Prince totters, Hellboy turns to look at Abe, momentarily distracted- Then-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 87
dialogues.text: Hellboy grimaces and looks down: the Prince's SPEAR TIP i half-buried in his chest...! The Prince sneers and gives the spear a savage yank, breaking off the blade! Hellboy's eyes roll upward; Liz SCREAMS. She and Johann manage to catch Hellboy as he collapses. The Prince reclaims the Princess and turns to the humans. His eyes seek out Abe, who has rushed to Hellboy's side.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: (showing off the Princess) If you want to see her again, you'll give me what's rightfully mine. Many people died for that crown. Bring it to me. He and his trolls escape into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stretched out on an operating table, HB is barely conscio Abe, in surgical goggles, probes the wound. In CLOSE-UP, Abe's webbed fingers lightly touch the glint metal that protrudes from Hellboy's sternum. The spear ti responds, as if alive; it wriggles, producing a GROAN fro HB. Liz is near panic.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Abe, stop studying! Pull the friggin' thing out, why don't you?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Liz, I'm sorry. It's a magical alloy. Every time I touch it, it moves closer to his heart. (GESTURING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, I'll show you... Liz backs away, shaking her head.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: No! I don't want to see it! (to Johann) We've got to do something!

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: I cannot reverse the magic- we have to look for the Prince or somebody that can help Red.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Go after that son-of-a-bitch and get him to reverse the spell!!

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: He'll demand the gold piece-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: So? We find it! We give it to him-!! Manning exchanges a worried look with a couple of his age in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz rummages in the Princess' quarters, throwing bedding around, opening drawers. 133

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz bursts into the conference room and starts shoving bo and papers aside, hunting high and low. 134

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johann walks into the control room. In every screen a cri situation is visible. JAGGED, BLURRY FOOTAGE shows a Yeti large in Nebraska and a Plesiosaurus at large in Scotland etc, etc-

dialogues.speaker: AGENT AGATE
dialogues.text: A lupgarou loose in Picadilly, a Winged creature nesting in a skyscraper- We have a situation in almost every point of the map. Johann looks back at a map with LED indicators signaling each crisis in the globe. They keep turning on a dozen a second.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: The Rebellion's spreading too fast- The only way to stop it is to stop the Prince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe enters the dark, soaking library and surveys the ruin of his tank. He goes directly to one of the book stands, which lies in pieces on the floor. He comes up with his copy of "Jane Eyre." He opens it to Chapter 23 and finds the gold piece.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Any luck? Liz has come in behind him. Abe quickly palms the preciou thing in his webbed hand.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: No. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: No -?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: No. Forget the gold piece. Let's us just find this royal asshole. (FIERCE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire and water, me and you, Abe. We'll kick his ass. Abe looks supremely troubled.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Abe, let's do this for Red! Abe nods, unable to find a good answer. He manages to tuc the gold piece into his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe stands at a lectern. Behind him, a projected image of the Princess' map from the troll market. His finger trace the strange, elvish text.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: The map contained within the cylinder seems useless- (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the case itself proves very useful- He moistens the holding cylinder case on a rubber stamp m and imprints the surface pattern on the paper map. Glyphs and coordinates become visible. A silhouette of a twisted, gnarly tree is visible too.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Renvyle it is- Both the Princess and her brother were born there. They hold it sacred.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Even if you're right, we sit tight and locate the gold piece, make sure he never ever gets his hands on it. If there's any truth to this legend, the fate of the world depends on it.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What about Red?? Don't you care about him??? A moment of silence. Nobody knows what to say. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Liz. That may be his destiny. Manning is right: we can't take the chance. Liz glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I see. Red was right about you. Welcome to the team, Johann. And goodbye. She leaves the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hellboy leans weakly against the doorway to his room. His cats purr all around him, oblivious to his pain. He sits the bed. Liz enters the room. He smiles weakly at her-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Sparky- It's all going to be

dialogues.speaker: ALRIGHT-
dialogues.text: Abe stands nearby, in silence. Liz looks at him, teary-ey

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: We'll make it alright. Screw Manning- You are right, Liz- We should just do this together: the three of us. Liz smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BPRD airplane sits quietly in its hangar. In the passenger compartment, Hellboy climbs up. He looks up to Liz smiling down at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abe's sitting in the pilot's seat, leafing through the massive airplane manual.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Engine, starting- refer to NA-7488-BD... Liz climbs in behind him.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: We stay here much longer, we're gonna get caught...

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Just a few more minutes. Here's an easy way to remember that "port" means "left." They each have four- A NOISE from the door: it's Johann.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Good evening, friends.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Don't try to stop us, Johann.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: On the contrary. I've been giving it some thought, and we should be able to save Hellboy. After all, the Prince lacks the gold crown. Without it, his army poses no threat. None at all. Abe is very quiet.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (in despair) Its useless- I- I- can't- I can't pilot this thing... Johann sits down in the co-pilot seat and melds with the controls...

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: I'll give it a try- Abe smiles at the sound of the engines starting up. 140

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manning bangs on a vending machine in one of the BPRD corridors. As a dribble of hot coffee splatters into his cup, a couple of AGENTS run up.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Sir - you'd better come, fast -

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Got it - ow! He burns his fingers on the coffee as he hurries after th agents. 141

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BPRD airplane is ROARING, amid clouds of exhaust fume The plane spins around and around in tight circles, its w tips knocking into ladders, lights and shelves. A bunch of agents are cowering in the doorway as Manning arrives.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Not ALL of them, it's not possible!

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Isn't that Johann at the controls?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 93
dialogues.text: Sure enough, they get a glimpse of the transparent head through the cockpit window. Abe's there, too. He raises a webbed hand to wave goodbye. The plane taxis outside onto the runway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .and takes off, barely under control, just missing the Ne Jersey treetops.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERGROUND 143
dialogues.text: The Prince pulls the Princess through fractured, roaring tunnels. Here and there, the walls are pierced, allowing light and ocean waves to enter. Rounding a few corners, the Prince stops near a wall decorated with a large, elaborate FRESCO. It shows a stylized family tree, hunting scenes and naive renderings trolls, faeries and ogres.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Maybe this will help you remember who we are, who you are... What our destiny is- The Prince pushes his sister through a low doorway, out o

dialogues.speaker: LEDGE 144
dialogues.text: -overlooking a vast cavern, big as a stadium, lit by a thousand torches. The mechanical ARMY stands knee-deep in heaving seawater and foam.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: They - they - will be mine to command, whether you like it or not. Only after our victory will you appreciate my sacrifice... and yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BPRD plane exits a bank of clouds and starts its desc upon an Irish island surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 94
dialogues.text: Massive granite mountains encircle an impossibly green valley.

dialogues.speaker: TNT. BPRD PLANE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Early sunlight washes over Hellboy's body, who weakly gro in Liz's arms.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (to Liz) Where are we, Liz..?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Near the ocean, Red.We'regonna make you well here.

dialogues.speaker: SIGN
dialogues.text: The back doors of the cargo plane opens and out come Abe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Abe help Hellboy up to a gnarled TREE, twisted by eons of wind. Abe unfurls the map and points at a drawing of a similar, weird tree.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: This should be the portal. By all rights- Johann reaches the tree and inspects it carefully.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Abe, bring the mapcase over here. He's found a roundish SLOT in the tree, where the lowest branch joins the trunk. Abe slips the map back into its crystal cylinder and holds it alongside: it looks to be a perfect fit.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Yes! Try it, Abe-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Before you do anything... remember what we're in for. A world unlike anything we've ever known. Dangerous, deceptive...

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: You're wasting time! Abe inserts and twists the cylinder. The tree comes to life, hauling its roots out of the grou bending them into a swaying arch.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Dangerous, deceptive... and hard to leave. They walk under the tree roots, into... 150

dialogues.speaker: FAIRY WORLD
dialogues.text: A transformed landscape. A perpetual nightland- Still overlooking the same ocean, but now throbbing with pale colors and twisted, Rackahm-esque contours. The men start down the hill, into a valley bordered by a rugged coastline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team reaches the stony shore of a mile-wide inlet. Ab brings out the map.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (pointing to the opposite shore) Renvyle is over there. They glance up and down the beach, looking for a boat. Hellboy blinks and sniffs the air. A GOBLIN speaks up from an outcropping of rocks in the shallows directly in front of them. By his side, sitting atop of a tree: A SATYR and a CROW observe the group.

dialogues.speaker: GOBLIN
dialogues.text: I bid you welcome, strangers. Would you be seeking safe passage to Renvyle?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Yes! Can you help us?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: (QUIET)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: SATYR
dialogues.text: I'm sure you can come to an understanding! The Goblin heaves on an oar and emerges from behind the rocks. He's standing in the stern of a sturdy little coracle. Its wooden hull is painted in Celtic patterns.

dialogues.speaker: GOBLIN
dialogues.text: Room enough for all of you! (looks at Hellboy) Even your weary friend.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: What will it cost, boatman? The Goblin smiles, displaying a disconcerting row of triangular teeth.

dialogues.speaker: GOBLIN
dialogues.text: Ah, next to nothing! Make me an offer. Abe, Johann and Liz confer among themselves:

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: He won't want money.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: (to the goblin) I have a... belt!

dialogues.speaker: OF
dialogues.text: Johann removes his equipment belt, dangling it in front the creature's bat-like face.

dialogues.speaker: GOBLIN
dialogues.text: I have no use for such a thing. Liz shows him her binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Here... is a wonderful set of eyes, magic eyes that will bring the world-

dialogues.speaker: GOBLIN
dialogues.text: I already have binoculars! No, I see something special. He points toward Hellboy's chest.

dialogues.speaker: SATYR
dialogues.text: Under his bandage - ! Quick as a squirrel, the creature hops to Hellboy's side brings out a KNIFE! SWISH! In one sweep of the blade, he reveals HB's terrible wound, and the speartip protruding from it.

dialogues.speaker: GOBLIN
dialogues.text: That! (points at the steel) That - in exchange for your crossing!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Don't you touch it - ! She rushes to Hellboy's side, pushing the Goblin back, re for a fight. The Goblin shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: GOBLIN
dialogues.text: Is it so precious to you? Let me pull it out.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: You mustn't. One touch can kill him. The Goblin's eyes grow wide with understanding.

dialogues.speaker: GOBLIN
dialogues.text: Ah. I see. We must go to the Angel of

dialogues.speaker: CROW
dialogues.text: He'll know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tiny boat is a dot on the golden waves of the inlet a the Goblin rows them to the opposite shore and docks near cove. The Goblin leads the way as Liz, Abe and Johann arrive an help Hellboy up.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 98
dialogues.text: Strange BIRDS hang upside down form the Cave's roof. A MASSIVE CHIMNEY has been carved out of the cave's rock at the other end. A Black, ancient figure is hunched there, warming its skeletal hands by the fire. A raspy voice utters something in an ancient language. Th Goblin replies, gesturing at Hellboy, who collapses on th floor. In a deep coma, Hellboy lies on the floor, near the crackling fireplace. The ANGEL OF DEATH extends its FOUR BLACK WINGS and a thin, jagged smile appears in its pale, eyeless face.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL OF DEATH
dialogues.text: So. This one... The boy- I remember him well! Anung-un-Rama!

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. She knows - ?!

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL OF DEATH
dialogues.text: I helped bring him into this world - in my fashion. It pulls a set of a glowing, red-hot TONGS out of the fir It studies the speartip, which has buried itself deep in Hellboy's flesh.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL OF DEATH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I warn you: it is his destiny to rule over the destruction of the Earth. Not now, not tomorrow - but some day. You are sure you want him to live?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Yes, I say yes-! Abe and Johann exchange a silent, worried look.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL OF DEATH
dialogues.text: Very well, then- but let it be said: The day will come when you will pay the price fire girl: This will bring you and the world much sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: And I'll deal with it when that time comes. Now save him. The creature cackles and then grips the spear tip with th tongs. A cry of pain from Hellboy as it withdraws the blo point from his chest.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 99
dialogues.text: The ANGEL OF DEATH holds up the speartip and looks at it with distaste.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL OF DEATH
dialogues.text: Harmless now. (looking at Hellboy) See - ? Hellboy's eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL OF DEATH
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) Sleep now, child. Your strength, it will return. A guttural HISS from the corner: the Goblin is jumping up and down, pointing at the speartip.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Our ferry captain - he wants his payment...

dialogues.speaker: ANGEL OF DEATH
dialogues.text: Ach, outside with you! She tosses the speartip to the creature, who scoops it up and bounds out the door. instantly, the goblins and birds leap down and crowd arou him, chattering in excitement over the latest prize. She gazes down at Hellboy, whose yellow eyes are fixed on her. He smiles wanly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone on a hilltop, Abe surveys the coastline. Through th binoculars, he discerns a SECOND CAVE half-hidden behind wild, breaking waves. Glancing back at ANGEL OF DEATH's cave, Johann strikes of on his own, headed for the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside ANGEL OF DEATH's hut, a bandaged HB is sitting up blinking in the sunlight. He sips some tea and gazes at L who is happy now.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: I almost lost you- Hellboy smiles and grabs her hand-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: I thought you were mad at me.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Well, no one can stay mad forever.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for all the attention, I thought it would be good for us.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: We're never going to make them all happy, Red. What we have is ours and no one

dialogues.speaker: BELLBOY
dialogues.text: I can turn my back on the world. I don't care anymore I don't- as long as you stay with me- as long as you think I'm still a good man. (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I a good man, Liz?? Am I??

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Yes you are. You are the best man I've ever met.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: You still seem sad. Is there anything you want to tell me-??

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Yes, there is-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Say it now, then. Whatever it is, I'm ready. (SIGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it about Johann-

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: No- no- what are you talking about?? Before she can go on, Johann appears. He carries a poulti and fresh rags.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Abe and I have found the entrance to the Golden Army's resting place- Liz come with us- (looks at Hellboy) You should stay behind and get some rest-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: And call you in the morning, right?? Like Hell I will. I'm keeping an eye on you,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johann, Liz and Hellboy follow a rugged trail along a blu high over the sea. Johann refers to the map, then points the cave opening a half-mile ahead. Abe is standing there

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: There. Abe points at the violent sea below-

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: The only way in- I'm afraid we'll have to jump in- (looks at Hellboy) Can you make it-? Hellboy nods.

dialogues.speaker: BELLBOY
dialogues.text: Strange. If this is the entrance-

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: I know- Why isn't there more security?? With a ROAR, WINK!!!!! - jumps out and throws a CHAIN aro Bellboy's neck! The chain is connected to his IRON MACE which now dangles around Hellboy's neck. The two creatures battle each other fiercely. WINK's MACE destroys a nearby tree, like a wrecking ball and it conne twice with Hellboy's head. But Red gets the upper hand quickly, snapping the chain i two and twirling the mace like a boleador.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 102
dialogues.text: He hits Wink again and again-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: See?? It hurts!!! It hurts!!! Hellboy grips the chain, pulls the creature close, then, like a weightlifter, raises him high overhead. With a mig GRUNT, Hellboy tosses him overboard. WINK hits the jagged rocks once- twice- thrice-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Ouch- ouch- ouch- (looking around) We better go swimming before any more ugly fellas show up- He stares down into the swirling waters and discreetly ta his hand to his bandaged side: He's bleeding. The wound h re-opened.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Red, are you-?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Don't say a word, Blue- Let's move on- 156

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johann plunges in from above, his body quickly tumbled by the rough seas. A moment later, Liz and Hellboy are in th water, too. Johann swims down, leading them into the darkness of the cave entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they bob up for air, they find there's only a few inch of breathing room between the sea and the rocky ceiling. starts coughing.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Hang on, people. I'll be right back. 158

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johann dives down to find a rusting, iron LOCK six feet under the surface. He tries to turn the control wheel, bu can't make it budge.

dialogues.speaker: BELLBOY 2 103
dialogues.text: Seconds later, Hellboy is at his side, gripping the wheel his huge hands. Using all his strength, Hellboy finally manages to turn it. His bandage, however, floats free... and his wound opens emitting a plume of blood. Lungs bursting, he shoots to the surface. Johann stays behind and swings open the lock, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: A STAIRWELL 159
dialogues.text: .carved from the living rock, leading upward into the depths of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRS
dialogues.text: The trio cautiously climbs the stairs, finding their way with light sticks. Hellboy stops to lean against the wall He dabs at his chest with a rag.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: (to Johann) Hold up. We need to rest.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Says who? I'm fine, I tell ya. He lurches forward, pushing past the others, fighting off his pain.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: (to Johann) This was a mistake. He's -

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Mein Gott-- The stairs lead to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -a vast underground arena where a thousand torches are flickering. CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal rank upon rank of GOLDEN SOLDIERS. Immobile. Silent. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: AMONG THE SOLDIERS 162
dialogues.text: Hellboy leads the way down a row of gleaming statues, pausing to gaze up at the blank face of one of the infantrymen.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Hey, amigo. You got some gum? Two rows away, Johann examines the lethal weaponry that terminates the arms of each soldier.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Most ingenious. A versatile, highly mobile killing machine.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Make that machines, Johann. I see more than one. Hellboy taps on a soldier's mechanical chest, which booms faintly, sending ECHOES up into the dark cavern.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Wow. You hear that? Listen - He thumps it, harder. The mechanical thing rocks backwards...

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Uh oh. CRASH!!! The thing falls onto the soldier behind it! Then
the ear-shattering noise of a hundred car wrecks builds a - a toppling LINE OF SOLDIERS races away like falling dominoes!!

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Whoops. The sound dwindles, then builds again as ANOTHER LINE of falling soldiers bears down on them!! Liz screams and Hellboy pulls her aside. The soldiers cra past them until - - the din suddenly stops. The PRINCE stands revealed at t head of the column.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: As a boy, they say I enjoyed toy soldiers. So do you, I see. He strolls past the mechanical figures, pausing to kick aside some of the weapons.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) You're bleeding. Most unfortunate. Hellboy wipes at his oozing chest wound.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Now it's your turn.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Do you envy these contraptions? They never bleed. They feel nothing. Not even the zest of combat. The Prince circles them, keeping an eye on Johann.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: These fighting men are the very model of patience... merely awaiting word from their lawful commander.

dialogues.speaker: AS
dialogues.text: From his tunic, he brings forth two of the gold segments. he fits them together...

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: You have the remaining piece, I presume.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: We do not -

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: (SURPRISED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you are most foolish. He gestures to some troll GUARDS near a tunnel entrance. They lead the Princess out in chains.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You came here expecting what? Mercy?

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: The death you would unleash will never happen! What you need is far from here and will stay out of your reach forever.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 106
dialogues.text: A VOICE reaches their ears from the tunnel entrance behin them.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Stop - I have it. Abe, dripping wet, stands there, the last gold segment in the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (APPROACHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here... For her... Take it...

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. What has he done? Keeping his eyes on the Princess, Abe gives the gold piec to the Prince. Hellboy steps forward, feeling dizzy and betrayed.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Abe -

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) You cannot fight him- not without hurting her... (BEAT )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do if it was Liz?? CLICK! The Prince fits the gold parts together and places the resulting crown on his head!

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: I am Prince Nuada and I command my army to life once more. Does anyone dispute my right? With the deep sound of gears, ratchets and springs, the a comes to life. Up comes the lances and shields.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (points at the team) Kill them. Abe is now aghast, seeing the Prince drag his sister back

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (to the Prince) That was your price!! A ransom, you said - paid in good faith!! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 107
dialogues.text: ABE(continued) (to Hellboy) Why, he lied to us!

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Abe old buddy. If we survive this, we need to talk. The Army swings into action, marching toward them. The fo friends retreat, soon pressed against one of the walls.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: He - he's a cad! Can you imagine, a highborn heir to the throne, last in a noble line of-

dialogues.speaker: BELLBOY
dialogues.text: Not now, Abe, okay? The first phalanx of golden soldiers is upon them, their terrifying weapons slashing in unison. Hellboy brings out his huge gun and starts firing as Johann grabs a torch an swings it like a club. A couple of the mechanical soldiers go down, only to pop back onto their feet, new weapons blossoming on their arm

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Let me - Liz summons up a white-hot burst of electrical fire in ea hand. With a yell, she unleashes a searing EXPLOSION at t oncoming fighters. The shock wave rolls through the enemy ranks, flattening scores of soldiers. For a moment, the BPRD team regains hope... but the endless lines of mechanicals keep coming, marching on and over their scorched comrades. Hellboy holsters the Samaritan and rushes forward, giving his best. His wound is running with fresh blood. He punches a soldier, whose mace pounds repeatedly agains his ravaged chest; as blood spatters his face, Hellboy groans and keeps fighting, to absolutely no effect. At length, the mechanical arms throw Hellboy against the wall, where he collapses, unable to carry on.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Invincibility!? So - the only one thing may stop them - Johann unzips his suit; with a HISSS, his ectoplasmic sel flows out, into the body of the nearest mechanical soldie

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 108
dialogues.text: Instantly, the thing whirls on its companions and starts chopping! Bits and pieces of gold machinery fly about as Johann rips into the enemy!! But again, fresh metal soldiers fill in for the fallen. A the BPRD team watches in dismay, Johann's mechanical shel is surrounded by the other SOLDIERS, who methodically dismember it like marauding insects! As the parts drop to the floor, twitching and useless, Johann slithers out and re-inhabits his suit.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Ach. They are too many. Anyone have another idea? Hellboy grabs the nearest sword and hauls himself to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (a bellow) Prince Nuada: I challenge your right to command this army! With a soft BOOM, the clockwork troops come to a halt! Al the mechanical heads turn toward the Prince, who stands o ledge with his sister.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (follows HB) No= please- no- Hellboy moves away from him.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: A challenge must be answered! Raise your sword!

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: A challenge from you? A nobody?? You are no one.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: No!! He is Anung-un-Rma- son of the Fallen one- He has the right! Her eyes lock with Abe's: there's no other way. The Prince sees Hellboy coming and with a bitter smile pi up his sword.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Very well. (to the BPRD team) May his fate show you the cost of pride and blindness. As the hall rings with their first blows of their swords-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Hellboy's too weak- Summoning up his last ounce of strength, Hellboy manages drive the Prince back into the center of the arena, where they fight under the inscrutable gaze of the golden army. Every time Hellboy gets a clean shot at the Prince, Abe looks at him, pleading, and HB has no choice but to keep parrying off his enemy. Hellboy's sword grows heavy in his hands; he stares at it dismay as it trembles. His muscles can no longer respond. The Prince is ready to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: (witness to a nightmare) No!! NO! ! A sudden movement at the ledge, where the Princess steps forward and... Using her concealed DAGGER, she STABS HERSELF in the righ arm!! In silent slow motion, she drops the dagger. Instantly, the Prince drops his arm... his hands come awa red with blood. He looks over at his sister. They share a hard look of mutual understanding. Love and hatred. Hellboy raises, through supreme effort, bleeding. He quic raises his sword. The fight resumes, but this time, HB ha the advantage. He fights bravely and after parrying fiercely with the Prince, he disarms him and points his sword at his chest.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: I- have- won-

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: No. You have not-

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 110
dialogues.text: He impales himself on HELLBOY's sword. The blade goes through his abdomen and protrudes on the other side. Hell pulls it out, but it's too late. Both the Prince and the Princess collapse to the ground, mortally wounded.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (GASPS)

dialogues.speaker: NO-
dialogues.text: Abe hurries to the Princess. Takes her into his arms, blinking in despair. The pale young creature is now a ghostly white. She lifts her eyes to Abe's, caressing his thin, scaly face.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: We'll find each other again, somewhere. And she dies in his arms. In the center of the arena:

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: (to Hellboy) You... think you're any different from me? The humans - they will tire of you. They will disappoint you. And in the end, they will betray you. You... are living a lie. Your time will come again. May you make a better choice. Then, he, too, is dead. Both him and his sister turn to fine, pale dust. And the wind carries away the ashes from Abe's hands... Shaken, Hellboy lifts the crown from the Prince's head. Looks at it carefully, as if considering the possibilitie Suddenly, he rips it into pieces. As he crushes the first segement... . an entire division of the golden army collapses into a heap of scrap metal! Hellboy does the same with a second section of the crown another massive division of the army tumbles into junk! HB is about the tear up the last segment of the crown, wh it explodes in his hands! WHUMP! The last of the army disintegrates. Hellboy confronts the Prince's frightened troll guards:

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (to the trolls) You - and your kind! Leave here. And stay in the shadows - where you belong. As the ogres slink back into the tunnels, Liz looks at Hellboy. He seems angry, stung by the Prince's last words

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BPRD team crosses waterfalls and stone bridges, throu the magical hills. Liz walks at Hellboy's side, but he avoids her glance. 164

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the strange, twisted tree. Johann takes the ma cylinder and fits it into the slot.

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Any last minute requests?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (very quiet) Do it, please. I - I'm ready for the real world now. Johann turns the cylinder. The tree roots form their arch and the BPRD team walks through. 165

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the tree: Manning and a bunch of age have set up spotter scopes and are gazing out over the countryside, looking for them. Suddenly, the team appears, literally from out of nowhere

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: (STARTLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! Where'd you come from? We were just-

dialogues.speaker: BELLBOY
dialogues.text: I know, here to help. Well, I appreciate that Manning.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY 2 112
dialogues.text: Abe steps past Hellboy and removes his gunbelt and equipm pack.

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Manning. I want to thank you, too. For all you've done for us over the years. He gives his stuff to the astonished agent.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: What? What, exactly is this?

dialogues.speaker: ABE
dialogues.text: (walking away) I quit. Hellboy glances at Abe, then hauls out the Samaritan and shrugs off his pack, too.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Come on. You're resigning?

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Looks that way, doesn't it? Hellboy starts to leave, but spins around and takes his g back.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think I'll keep this. He finally meets Liz's gaze. She crosses to him and takes him by the arm. She walks off with Hellboy and Abe, cling tightly to the big, red daemon.

dialogues.speaker: MANNING
dialogues.text: Liz -- not you, too!? (to Johann) They can't do this. Stop them, Johann-

dialogues.speaker: JOHANN
dialogues.text: Manning, you're an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles down the road, Abe stands on a promontory, staring at the ocean, which blazes with golden reflections. Liz and HB sit next to each other on some mossy rocks. Overhead: blue sky, puffy white clouds.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: What you said before - about us living

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: I mean it! `Course, I'm thinking USA... but, hey - you decide.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: (breathing deep) Let's find a place in the country. Clean air - green hills - fresh milk from the farm.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Milk? Yech.

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: A yard... With lots of room to grow in.

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: (he looks blank) Grow? who gonna grow- ?

dialogues.speaker: LIZ
dialogues.text: Our baby, that's who!

dialogues.speaker: HELLBOY
dialogues.text: Our b-? On Hellboy's immense grin: FREEZE FRAME. Roll CREDITS. At the end of the credits-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 ZINCO ENTERPRISES helicopters land on the hard, icy surface of Amundsen's glacier. A row of GUARDS in black garb flank each helicopter. Out of one of them exits RODERICK ZINCO, billionare, madm He carries a mechanized container, a little larger than a hat box. CAMERA follows as he enters through a crevace an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light shines through the ice walls and into rows and rows machinery.
